Jack Cody.Action: Yells enthusiastically for the fighters, embracing the brutal spectacle.
Ignores beautiful woman leaving upset by the violence, showing lack of concern for her feelings.
Responds cheerfully to Frankie, agrees to clean up the mess and finish work.
Stops his fantasy fight to answer Frankie and cleans up the broken mannequins.
Picks up trash from neighbor’s yard despite living in a run-down area.
Shows up at the scene when gang members threaten Sally, and physically intervenes to protect her, taking down multiple attackers.
Initially pauses and evaluates the scene instead of immediately rushing in to help.
Pauses to assess the situation carefully before acting.
Creates a distraction by leaving an empty Jeep with lights and horn on to confuse the gang.
Surprises and efficiently overpowers multiple gang members with skilled combat techniques.
Turns to Sally and smiles, motions for her to join him after the fight.
Expresses playful tolerance toward Sally's grandfather by saying 'Don't worry, I love old codgers.'
Looks at Sally for help when harshly confronted by her grandfather, showing respect for her family dynamics.
Pushes through a crowd of reporters and neighbors to check on his mother despite distractions.
Drives away while still angry after leaving Sally's house, not resolving underlying tension.
Tries one more time to touch Grandfather but misses, showing slight clumsiness.
Immediately concerned for his mother’s well-being upon entering the room.
Humbly downplays his heroic actions, saying 'I just did what had to be done.'
Reluctantly agrees to face the crowd despite personal discomfort.
Takes media attention with good humor despite being overwhelmed.
Responds to reporters with characteristic good humor despite being bombarded with questions.
Waves back and acknowledges children asking for autographs, feeling good about the interaction.
Slows pace slightly when smiled at by a woman runner, but continues running without engaging further.
Speaks to his mother calmly despite her haranguing about his decisions.
States to reporters 'I just did what I had to do. Anybody else would have done the same.' showing humility and sincerity.
Handles media attention with good humor and composure.
Responds modestly to praise, attributing success to necessity.
Slows pace when approached by attractive women while running, showing a momentary lapse in training focus.
Asks his mother for help tying his necktie, showing vulnerability and a friendly request.
Expresses frustration at his mother's refusal to help, but still tries to maintain politeness with 'Thanks a lot!'
Tries to move out of the way and close his open mouth in surprise upon meeting the SuperFighters, showing awe and a lack of composure.
Responds politely and somewhat hesitantly to introductions from the SuperFighters despite being starstruck, showing mild social skill.
Declines an offer for a drink and thanks Robert Sawyer professionally, indicating respectful and composed behavior.
Enthusiastically accepts the offer to become a SuperFighter and shows excitement about training with Angel.
Quietly watches Angel leave the room, showing attentive and respectful behavior.
Arrives on time to training gym and acknowledges readiness to train.
Walks around the high-tech training gym in awe, showing surprise.
Follows Angel's instructions attentively and performs well during training without complaint.
Responds politely and respectfully to Angel during the interaction.
Jokes about being pranked by others with a laugh, acknowledging it as a 'rookie thing.'
Caught looking at Angel, despite not wanting to, indicating a lapse in respect or control.
Stops to sign autographs for fans, including kids.
Kneels down to talk sincerely to a kid who admires him.
Responds gently and honestly to the kid's question, 'I try my best, kid.'
Expresses self-doubt and insecurities about his skills and authenticity in the fight.
Engages in playful sparring and affectionate interaction with Angel, returning her kiss briefly.
Respectfully declines to take advantage of Angel's invitation for a more intimate encounter, citing their friendship and trainer relationship.
Trains seriously, tries to confront a mysterious figure.
Denies corruption and wrongdoing despite warnings.
Engages in fight with Masked Man who warns him of danger.
Asks how to get out after hearing concerning information.
Smiles and greets Sally warmly; embraces her upon reunion.
Eager to begin training, encourages Grandfather by saying 'Time's a wasting'.
Breaks embrace with Sally reluctantly on Grandfather's command.
Glances at the money in the suitcase but continues on to the restroom without hesitation.
Is in training with Grandfather, practicing qi cultivation and sticking hands diligently, showing willingness to learn and improve skill.
Stunned and silent when Wang gives him all the money, showing surprise and hesitation.
Follows footsteps quietly out of curiosity rather than confrontation, observing rather than intervening.
Approaches Angel warmly, calls out to her, and jogs over to join her, sharing a moment of connection with a smile.
Hesitates, appears worried, and contemplates consequences before deciding to enter the dangerous event with Angel.
Worries about his friend Budokai getting hurt badly and urges Robert to intervene to prevent serious injury or death.
Yanks Angel to her feet, asks for help to save Budokai despite risks.
Jumps into the ring to save Budokai from the Beast, protecting him physically.
Negotiates with the Beast to retreat after rescuing Budokai.
Demanded release of his mother and Sally before fighting seriously.
Focused on protecting his mother and Sally despite being overmatched in the fight.
Attacks and quickly defeats Darkcloud and Night Stalker to rescue loved ones.
Uses physical violence against opponents during a coerced fight.
Closes his eyes and blocks a deadly strike without looking, then counters effectively to defeat Robert.
Stands up to face an aggressive opponent after his friend Angel is gravely injured.
Momentarily holds Angel as she dies, showing emotional vulnerability but no immediate action to change the situation.
Returns salute confidently to Budokai and interacts warmly with Sally and his mother, showing social skill and confidence.
Puts his hand in resin and leaves a conspicuous handprint on Grandfather's jacket, potentially careless or thoughtless action.
Yells his lungs out for the fighters, showing enthusiasm and focus on the fight.
Ignores a beautiful woman leaving, indicating single-minded focus on the fight.
Yells loudly for Angel to continue brutalizing her opponent after the towel was thrown in.
Prefers mercy for Budokai against the Enforcer, showing sympathy for the fighter he likes.
Runs to break Budokai's fall after he is thrown out of the ring.
Stands up with Budokai, shows concern despite being stunned.
Engages the enraged Enforcer to protect Budokai.
Beams with pride and accepts Budokai's thanks and recognition openly.
Runs to break Budokai's fall after he goes sailing out of the ring.
Turns to face the Enforcer and throws kicks and punches that have no effect and only enrage the opponent further.
Trains intensely, demonstrating disciplined physical skill by breaking multiple mannequins and targeting the last one with a complex kick.
Successfully picks himself up and cleans the mess he made, showing responsibility and practical approach to his training environment.
Pauses to reflect on his aspirations (looking at posters and saying 'Someday...'), indicating thoughtful planning and motivation.
Smiles and rests with head in hands after falling down from a move, showing awareness of his limits and not denying failure.
Does not respond immediately to Frankie’s calling, which could show distraction or disengagement momentarily.
Picks up trash from neighbor's yard before going inside.
Answers mother's concerns with impatience and avoids deeper emotional conversation.
Walks away from his mother despite her attempts to engage and express care.
Gets to work on time, avoids conflict, remains calm and confident in conversation with his mother.
Walks away from his mother despite her emotional pressure, indicating resolve and self-control.
Responds to mother's concerns about fighting with a focused and realistic attitude ('I'm not in the ring... yet').
Uses martial arts skills to take out multiple gang members with little resistance.
Immediately drives Sally away from the scene quickly after the fight.
Shows confidence by engaging with Sally and accepting her invitation to meet her grandfather.
Responds to Sally's grandfather's scolding with a sarcastic, somewhat flippant remark.
Admits he can handle himself and responds calmly to Grandfather's challenge without escalating hostility.
Tries to explain himself and engages with Sally somewhat respectfully despite the tension.
Tries to pull away from Grandfather’s grip but does not respond with aggression or insult.
Gets frustrated and decides to leave but promises to call Sally.
Attempts one more time to touch Grandfather before leaving, showing persistence rather than malice.
Claims to use multiple fighting styles and adapts what works.
Attempts to prove skill and engage in a sparring test with Grandfather.
Fails repeatedly to touch Grandfather during the test, showing lack of skill.
Attempts to leave the situation when it becomes clear he is outmatched, showing some situational awareness.
Underestimates Grandfather initially and tries to catch him unaware, but fails.
Tries to touch Grandfather before leaving, implying a subtle attempt at connection.
Shows concern for his mother immediately upon arriving home and pushes through crowd to check on her.
Responds modestly and dismisses the 'hero' label from a reporter.
Responds humbly and warmly to SuperFighters' greetings, tries to engage with them naturally.
Politely declines a drink, thanks Robert for the invitation and expresses appreciation for meeting the team.
Accepts the offer to become a SuperFighter eagerly and confidently.
Does not have an agent and seems unsure if he should have one.
Listens attentively to Angel's introduction and training offer, shows willingness to learn.
States confidently that he is a tough negotiator and no pushover during contract discussion.
Shows hesitation and embarrassment during Angel's invasive training method, questions appropriateness.
Complies with Angel's instructions despite discomfort (catches pills, listens to instructions).
Moves incredibly quick and brutal, strikes down two bodyguards immediately.
Calls bluff on an opponent holding a hostage and strikes effectively.
Analyzes opponent's pain reactions after hitting him, adjusts technique accordingly.
Fails to notice Lonnie’s throat is slashed during the fight.
Pays the restaurant tab despite others' protestations.
Declines Angel’s invitation to join her on the bed, moves on politely.
Lives in an incredible, well-equipped apartment in an exclusive gated community, reflecting a stable and successful personal environment.
Shakes his head and declines to join Angel on the bed, showing self-control and discipline.
Pays the expensive meal bill despite protests, indicating responsibility and confidence in managing social and financial situations.
Arrives late for workout with Angel, indicating possible poor time management or lack of punctuality.
Upgraded from a beat-up Jeep to a beautiful new Jeep Cherokee Sport, suggesting progress and improvement in lifestyle through capable efforts.
Smiles and acknowledges Frankie positively when greeted.
Does not see or respond to Sally attempting to say hello.
Barely acknowledges someone entering the locker room, too exhausted to react.
Trains extremely hard with Angel, enduring intense physical workouts and pushing limits.
Takes a pill handed by Angel before training without hesitation.
Smiles and drives on when Frankie calls him, ignoring the interruption.
Does not notice Sally trying to get his attention, missing a social cue.
Stops at the sink to take his 'vitamin' before workout, showing discipline and routine.
Slow to respond or almost unresponsive when disturbed in locker room due to exhaustion.
Acknowledges his own mistake by calling it a 'rookie thing' and laughs it off.
Stops to look at Angel despite not wanting to, indicating a momentary lack of self-control or focus.
Smiles a little after scoring a kick to Angel's body.
Bows and touches fists with Angel before the fight, showing respect and sportsmanship.
Catches himself and pulls away when Angel moves from a celebratory embrace to something more intimate.
Initiates a casual conversation with Angel about Rasputin's death, showing some concern and interest.
Nervously seeks reassurance from peers before fight.
Shows vulnerability by admitting nervousness.
Appears nervous but tries to stay composed before the fight, takes deep breaths, and listens to encouragement from peers.
Is confident enough to face a formidable opponent called The Enforcer, showing willingness to engage despite doubts.
Gets slammed in the face quickly by The Enforcer, indicating a failure to defend or anticipate attack effectively.
Looks for Angel after being slammed, taps The Enforcer on the shoulder before attacking, uses techniques taught by Angel, raises hands to celebrate, looks for Sally in the crowd
Does not acknowledge Sally after she gives him a signal, continues fight and later kisses Angel deeply when Sally approaches
Gets slammed and thrown to the canvas multiple times but absorbs the punishment as instructed.
Recovers despite being nearly out, spots Sally instead of Angel, and starts to get up anyway.
Taps The Enforcer on the shoulder to gain attention and follows it immediately with a powerful right cross, initiating a skillful counter-attack.
Executes a series of beautiful, practiced movements taught by Angel to incapacitate The Enforcer, culminating in a flying spinning hook kick knock-out.
Does not pursue Sally after noticing her seat empty, instead is quickly drawn into an unexpected kiss by Angel, resulting in a missed opportunity to resolve situation.
Helps steady a kicking bag for Budokai and responds positively to his kick without ridicule.
Budokai helps him up after knocking Jack into the wall, Jack accepts help graciously.
Jack responds with friendly camaraderie towards other fighters while training together.
Successfully participates in trainings and sparring with other SuperFighters.
Maintains composure and humor after being pushed into the wall by Budokai's kick and quickly recovers.
Responds casually and accepts help from Budokai after falling, showing humility and social awareness.
Shows confidence and skill in the ring by knocking out an opponent without injury.
Appears jumpy and startled by Angel's touch during stretching.
Stops and signs autographs for fans including a serious kid asking if he's a hero, responding kindly and confidently.
Wins a fight against a bigger, faster, better opponent using an impressive and very distinctive style.
Wins against a bigger, faster, better opponent using his distinctive style.
Questions his own ability and worries if others are taking it easy on him because he's new.
Refuses to take advantage of Angel despite temptation, maintaining professional boundaries as his trainer and friend.
Trains and throws punches while working on endurance.
Stops running when spooked by a mysterious figure.
Fights a superior masked opponent but cannot block his attacks.
Insists he is a great fighter despite evidence to the contrary.
Asks how to get out of dangerous situation and considers warnings.
Approaches Sally's grandfather quietly and watches his martial arts routine with respect and admiration.
Admits feeling unwelcome and struggles with explaining his absence to Sally's grandfather.
Responds sincerely to grandfather's questions, showing openness and humility.
Accepts grandfather's invitation to come to Sally's training early in the morning to surprise her.
Asks grandfather to teach him to move like him, indicating willingness to learn and connect.
Observes an expert martial artist attentively and shows willingness to learn by agreeing to attend training and asking to be taught.
Admits having no answer for why he hasn’t visited Sally, indicating some uncertainty or lack of confidence in his personal decisions.
Thanks Grandfather for having him and agrees to come back early next day.
Invites Sally to have dinner, showing friendly or warm interest.
Reassures Grandfather to have Sally home by 11:00 pm, showing respect and sincerity.
Smiles at Darkcloud’s joke, indicating friendly interaction.
Refuses to take performance-enhancing pills despite peer pressure, acts with integrity.
Deceptively fakes taking the pills to avoid steroids and potential mind control.
Shows willingness to follow the Grandfather's rules and advice.
Acknowledges the dilemma about not getting stronger without pills, showing awareness of consequences.
Smiles and jokes by mispronouncing 'qi' and saying 'Bless you' after Grandfather explains qi.
Nods in respect after Grandfather demonstrates qi power by throwing him across the room.
Attempts to punch the can demonstrating willingness to engage with new training, showing openness and initiative.
Mimics Grandfather’s qi technique but fails to move the can and initially thinks it's a trick, showing skepticism and lack of skill.
Learns to correctly pronounce 'Qi' after correction, indicating adaptability and willingness to learn.
Successfully withstands Grandfather’s qi palm strike and nods in recognition, showing growing capability and resilience.
Struggles significantly with meditation, unable to concentrate and keeps shifting position, indicating difficulty mastering skills and possibly impatience.
Says 'Your grandfather's a great guy' and acknowledges he was looking out for Sally.
Pauses and observes Robert opening a briefcase with money, showing curiosity but does not intervene or confront.
Decides to attack Grandfather during meditation but is quickly blocked and reprimanded.
Acknowledges his coach's feedback about his lack of progress honestly.
Observes Robert placing a briefcase with a lot of money and discreetly pauses to watch before continuing.
Sits patiently with Grandfather and Sally despite being bored, shares excitement about moving the can.
Responds to Robert's harsh message with a smile and a joke, indicating tolerance and good nature.
Looks to Angel after Robert leaves but notices she avoids his gaze, shows empathy and concern.
Notices Sally's concerned look and gathers himself to fight back, showing care and sensitivity to others' feelings.
Questions why he has to take a dive, showing a hint of skepticism and reluctance but not aggressively rejecting.
Refuses to give up or take a dive as scripted, choosing to fight back and show defiance.
Appears dazed and confused early in the fight, failing to follow the scripted dive.
After regaining composure, fights back with skill and confidence using techniques taught by his Grandfather.
Sidesteps a dangerous charge and mounts a fast, furious counterattack.
Questions why he should take a dive, revealing some confusion about his role but also some independent thinking.
Pauses before delivering knockout blow, looks at Angel and crowd for Robert.
Attempts to explain himself calmly to Robert after confrontation.
Promises to follow orders and shows respect to Robert despite tension.
Is stunned and has no answer when questioned by Wang about his actions.
Observes and processes the truth about the overstated threat (Chinese Mafia head) and accepts the situation reluctantly.
Follows the henchmen quietly and cautiously in the parking garage to investigate the situation.
Is alarmed and pulls back when confronted by Robert and the Beast, showing caution but no immediate reaction.
Reacts to the tortured cries of the Beast with visible sickness and discomfort.
Fights back against an attacker to defend himself instead of passively accepting harm.
Acknowledges the truth about the Beast and expresses reluctance but does not outright refuse to act.
Expresses desire to just quit and get out, showing some self-focus rather than immediate willingness to help.
Engages in a fight with the Masked Man and demonstrates clear improvement by overpowering him.
Reacting to the cries of the Beast with sickness and emotionally affected, choosing to leave the scene rather than intervene.
Expresses reluctance and uncertainty about taking action against Robert Sawyer, stating 'I just want out.'
Stops the door gently when his mother tries to close it; admits she was right and that 'they're trouble'; expresses a desire to talk and reconcile.
Hugs his mother warmly upon entering the house.
Introduces Sally to his mother, showing inclusiveness and trust.
Takes the risk of entering a dangerous, high-stakes environment despite uncertainty, deciding to face potential danger rather than flee.
Appears worried and uncertain while waiting for information, showing some hesitation and lack of immediate confidence.
Watches the brutal fight and reacts with concern, gets up and urges Robert to intervene to protect Budokai.
Fails to stop the violent match despite knowing the danger; depends on others (Robert) to intervene without a clear plan of action.
Sits next to the critically injured Budokai, offers encouragement despite bleak prognosis.
Nods and tries to focus his qi to help Budokai recover.
Refuses to fully engage immediately, stating he needs to get his mom because 'they know where I live.'
Stays and attempts to help Budokai when Sally offers to get Jack's mom.
Sleeps on the couch after draining himself to help Budokai, indicating fatigue but willingness to stay.
Responds seriously and defensively on the phone with Robert after hearing a harsh comment about the fight.
Demanded that Sally and his mother be released.
Checked on Budokai and expressed concern for his condition.
Informed Budokai about Sally and his mother being held hostage.
Manuevers Robert into a corner and hits him hard enough to pin him under falling debris.
Attacks and quickly defeats Darkcloud and Night Stalker by surprise to rescue his mother and Sally.
Has a hard time concentrating during the fight due to concern for his mother and Sally.
Is clearly no match for Robert’s technique and is getting repeatedly hit without success.
Demonstrates persistence and quick thinking under pressure despite being outmatched.
Returns Budokai's fist salute, shares a moment of closeness with Sally and his mother, smiles, and playfully hits Grandfather on the back.
